content.rendered:
Website for Bright Side Studios an Edinburgh based innovation studio.

Vimeo’s API was utilised to create a connection between Bright Side’s Vimeo channel and the website content in order to showcase their videos.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Bright Side Studios an Edinburgh based innovation studio.

content.rendered:
Website for The Farr Institute of Health Informatics Research, a publicly funded UK-wide research collaboration involving 21 academic institutions and health partners.

Key features include a people directory and a publication centre.

The directory allows users to search using multiple criteria such as a free search as well as look-up lists for research speciality and institution. The document centre is a sortable listing containing all the publication details, links to both download and view.

excerpt.rendered: Website for The Farr Institute of Health Informatics Research, a publicly funded UK-wide research collaboration involving 21 academic institutions and health partners.

content.rendered:
Browser-based apps for Myeloma UK, a non-profit organisation based in Edinburgh, Scotland.

Two apps, a Trial Finder and a Drug Tracker, were built in WordPress frameworks for Myeloma UK to be part of their WordPress multisite network.

The Trial Finder provides users with the necessary information so that they could apply, or refer others, to any particular myeloma treatment trial across the country.

The Drug Tracker app is a useful, informative and illustrative tool that helps patients, their friends, family and carers, as well as industry professionals to understand the changing nature of new the drug development ‘pipeline’ – and our involvement in that area.

excerpt.rendered: Browser-based apps for Myeloma UK, a non-profit organisation based in Edinburgh, Scotland.

content.rendered:
Website for Dubai based photographer, Mike McKelvie.

A lightbox and downloadable PDF creator was built for the site. This allows users to compile a lightbox collection of all the images they chose from the site. The user’s collection can be re-ordered to a custom order and can be shared with a friend or downloaded as a PDF.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Dubai based photographer, Mike McKelvie.

content.rendered:
Website for Mute, the independent record label founded by Daniel Miller in 1978.

Custom plugins were developed for this site each with very specific requirements. Two notable plugins examples were the following:

One extracted the live gig data from SongKick twice daily and imported it into the WordPress system.

The other was created to allow seamless integration with Mute’s MadMimi mailing system via the WordPress CMS. When a new artist is created a corresponding segment is created in Mute’s MadMimi subscriber list. Segments allow for the maximum targeting of their audience.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Mute, the independent record label founded by Daniel Miller in 1978.

content.rendered:
Website for Edinburgh based photographer, Christopher Thomas.

A key feature is the secure & private preview that allows the photographer’s client to view their images online.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Edinburgh based photographer, Christopher Thomas.

content.rendered:
Website and game to accompany the release of Harmonic 313′s EP, Word Problems.

When the users completes the game by solving the word problems they are rewarded with a free MP3 download.

excerpt.rendered: Website and game to accompany the release of Harmonic 313′s EP, Word Problems.

content.rendered:
Website to accompany the album release of Hello Everything from recording artist Squarepusher.

A linear structure was created where the user could navigate via the directional arrow keys as well as the standard point & click.

excerpt.rendered: Website to accompany the album release of Hello Everything from recording artist Squarepusher.

title.rendered: Scottish Album of The Year Award

content.rendered:
Website for the Scottish Music Industry Association’s inaugural Scottish Album of The Year Award.

The award was, in part, voted for by the public. On the day of the public vote the voting page automatically enabled to allow votes to be cast. All voting from the website was logged with the smartphone app using an API.

excerpt.rendered: Website for the Scottish Music Industry Association’s inaugural Scottish Album of The Year Award.

content.rendered:
Website for Snowsport Industries of Great Britain, the trade association for skiing and snowboarding in the UK.

Key features includes a members directory incorporating a search that will identify the nearest shops to the location the user enters as a search criteria and a secure members-only area.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Snowsport Industries of Great Britain, the trade association for skiing and snowboarding in the UK.

content.rendered:
Website for Numbers, a Glasgow based  record label.

A tailored tagging system was implemented so the content could be interconnected. The connections are visible via SVG lines mapped between the related content.

excerpt.rendered: Website for Numbers, a Glasgow based  record label.

content.rendered:
Website for independent record label, Warp Records.

An IP-sensing region filter was introduced so the user received content which was most relevant to them. Alternatively the user could manually set the region so they could filter the news, releases and events content specific to their chosen location.

excerpt.rendered: Website for independent record label, Warp Records.

content.rendered:
Website for fashion label Project D London.

A fully integrated Ecommerce solution to allow customers worldwide to shop directly from the fashion label.

excerpt.rendered: Website for fashion label Project D London.
